metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7747 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in the afReadFrames function in audiofile (aka libaudiofile and Audio File Library) allows user-assisted remote attackers to cause a denial of service (program crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted audio file, as demonstrated by sixteen-stereo-to-eight-mono.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7747` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

audiofile-tools - 0.3.6-2ubuntu0.14.04.1
libaudiofile1 - 0.3.6-2ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: audiofile package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.3.6-2ubuntu0.14.04.1').
